name: Game On: The Future of Sports and Gaming Collide

contributors.name: Sadia Noor
contributors.title: Creative Partner
contributors.details: Sadia Noor is the Creative Partner at Small World, the entertainment-obsessed creative agency behind viral campaigns for brands like Duolingo, Under Armour, and Hot Topic. With a background in both agency and creator worlds, she leads with taste, speed and cultural intuition, turning creators into creative directors, brands into broadcasters, and briefs into shows. Her work spans sitcoms, sports campaigns, and celebrity-led stunts, always rooted in one belief: if it’s not entertaining, it’s not working.

contributors.name: James Salmon
contributors.title: Senior Director Partnership Marketing, EA SPORTS FC
contributors.details: James Salmon is Senior Director, Partnerships Marketing at EA SPORTS FC, where he leads strategic brand, broadcast, talent, and platform partnerships to grow engagement across the global football ecosystem. In his role, James focuses on activating rights, building iconic collaborations, and shaping marketing strategies that connect millions of fans with EA SPORTS FC’s culture and community initiatives. His career in football and sports media includes leadership positions at organisations such as The FA and BT Sport (now TNT Sports), reflecting a deep passion for the sport and its fans. At EA SPORTS FC, James champions initiatives that bridge digital, grassroots, and real-world football experiences, helping expand the game’s reach and relevance worldwide.

contributors.name: Kevin Durkin
contributors.title: Consumer Strategy & Sports Partnerships
contributors.details: Kevin Durkin is Senior Director, Head of Consumer Strategy & Sports Partnerships at Epic Games, where he leads global commercial strategy and builds key partnerships at the intersection of gaming, culture, and sports. Since joining Epic in 2020, Kevin has helped shape strategic initiatives that expand brand engagement and drive growth across consumer and sports ecosystems. Prior to Epic, he held roles in digital commerce, strategy, and partnerships, including work with The MBA Fund, HAUS Laboratories, Nike, and Deloitte. Kevin holds an MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business and degrees in business and professional accounting from the University of Washington.

contributors.name: Dan Salkey
contributors.title: Founder
contributors.details: Dan Salkey is Strategy Partner at Small World, the entertainment-first agency behind work for brands like Duolingo, Oatly, and Dr. Squatch. He helps brands act less like advertisers and more like entertainers, building creative teams of un-standard talent and turning marketing into culture. Dan also co-authored the Entertain or Die report, a global index ranking the most entertaining brands on Earth. His mission: help brands earn attention by being worth watching.

description: The next wave of sports fandom won’t be built in stadiums; it’ll be built in-game. From the NBA’s digital court activations to Fortnite’s immersive events and EA Sports’ evolving cultural platform, the lines between sport and play are blurring fast. This panel explores how gaming is reshaping how fans engage with sport, not just watching, but emulating, remixing, and co-creating it. The future of global sport is interactive, creator-powered, and playable.

He is currently the VP of Creative Services at Crunchyroll, the global brand that fuels fans’ love of anime.

Originally from Riga, Latvia, brought up in the US, and trained at RMIT in Melbourne, Australia, Norman has served in creative leadership roles for both agencies and in-house companies across industries.

description: Fandoms aren’t audiences; they’re communities. And communities thrive on meaning, identity, and emotion. This panel explores how brands use design to speak the language of fans and build deep cultural connections. From anime to gaming to pop culture collabs, motion mnemonics, and type systems inspired by subculture, we’ll unpack how visual identity becomes a tool for trust, transformation, and belonging. When done right, design doesn’t just sell, it unites.

name: Technologies of Care: Ritual, Play, & the Future of Wellness

image.alt_text: Technologies of Care: Ritual, Play, & the Future of Wellness

contributors.name: Sarah Ticho
contributors.title: Director
contributors.details:
Sarah is a multidisciplinary artist, creative strategist, and change maker working at the threshold of immersive storytelling, healthcare, and collective healing. Founder of Hatsumi, she created SOUL PAINT (SXSW Special Jury Prize 2024), which has been exhibited at the United Nations, London Film Festival, and 10 Downing Street.

She is the co-director of the XR Health Alliance and co-authored The Growing Value of XR in Healthcare in the United Kingdom, which helped catalyse a £20 million UKRI investment into emerging care technologies.

Described by Forbes as a “Renaissance person”, Sarah's work has been featured in The Hollywood Reporter and the BBC. She has spoken at platforms including YouTube, Games for Change, Stanford University, and the United Nations.

contributors.name: Niki Smit
contributors.title: Director
contributors.details:
Bio Niki Smit.
Niki Smit is a multi-award winning Director of interactive and experiential art. 
He is co-founder / creative Director at Monobanda, where he explores and expands the boundaries of play, embodied interaction and emergent storytelling. Additionally, he is director at ExploreDEEP, where he creates meditative, breath controlled VR experiences that are employed in scientific research and clinical therapy  

His work focuses heavily on researching and developing new forms of playful behaviour. His passion lies in creating projects that connect the human body, physical space and the virtual world in surprising ways, creating meaningful embodied experiences that fill the space between art, science and mental wellbeing.
  
He has collaborated and lectured with numerous international organizations, universities, research groups and museums.Smit’s most notable awards include the Dutch Directors Guild award for Best Digital Storytelling 2020, and Special Jury Award SXSW 2024 for Soul Paint. His projects have drawn international attention, with features in leading outlets like Forbes Washington Post, VICE, Hollywood Reporter, the Guardian Polygon, Engadget and more. His project DEEP is featured in a dedicated chapter of the book Checkpoint: How video games power up minds, kick ass and save lives , and has been the focus of nine published scientific studies.

description: This interactive talk will explore how artist-led, science-backed immersive experiences can foster emotional expression and wellbeing. Award-winning artists behind Explore Deep and Soul Paint, Sarah Ticho (Hatsumi, XR Health Alliance) and Niki Smit (Monobanda) share tools for co-creating rituals of care through creative health design. Participants will explore emotional mapping, embodiment, and cross-sector collaboration to imagine new pathways for impact across health, art, and education.

name: Spinning Out: What It Takes to Build a University Startup

image.alt_text: Spinning Out: What It Takes to Build a University Startup

contributors.name: Jim Adox
contributors.title: Managing Partner
contributors.details: Jim Adox is Managing Partner of Venture Investors Health Fund in Ann Arbor, where he invests in medical devices, diagnostics, and digital health. He brings deep technical and operational experience, holding two issued U.S. medical device patents. Jim serves on the board of HistoSonics, a University of Michigan spinout where he led the Series A and B financings and supported the company through a $2.25B change-of-control transaction. He also serves on the boards of ViaLase, EarliPoint Health, and Dvant Pharma, and previously co-founded and served as CEO of Tissue Regeneration Systems, acquired by Johnson & Johnson and Medtronic. Jim holds BS, MS, and MBA degrees from the University of Michigan.

contributors.name: Charlie Childs
contributors.title: Co-Founder & CEO
contributors.details: Charlie Childs, Ph.D. is co-founder and CEO of Intero Biosystems, a biotech company working to replace animal testing with miniature human organs grown in the lab. She earned her BS from the University of Wisconsin–Madison and her PhD from the University of Michigan, where she trained as a stem cell scientist and bioinformatician. At Intero, Charlie leads development of human-relevant testing platforms that help researchers predict how drugs and chemicals will affect people before reaching patients. Her work aims to make drug development safer, faster, and more effective, while reducing reliance on animal testing.

contributors.name: Adam Molnar
contributors.title: Co-Founder & Head of Business and Partnerships
contributors.details: Adam Molnar is co-founder and VP of Strategic Partnerships at Neurable, a Boston-based neurotechnology company pioneering brain–computer interface technology for everyday devices. A Forbes 30 Under 30 honoree in Consumer Technology, he earned a BA from the University of Michigan’s Program in the Environment, focusing on behavior change and entrepreneurship. At Neurable, Adam leads partnerships with OEMs and global brands to commercialize AI-powered brain-sensing technology across cognitive health and human performance. He also founded NeuroTechX’s content initiative and serves as an advisor to the Institute of Neuroethics, advocating for ethical, accessible neurotechnology as the industry scales.

contributors.company: Innovation Partnerships at the University of Michigan
contributors.name: Michael Psarouthakis
contributors.title: Executive Director of Impact Investments & Strategic Alliances
contributors.details:
As Executive Director of Impact Investments & Strategic Alliances at Innovation Partnerships, Mike leads U-M’s investment programs, including the Accelerate Blue Fund and the Michigan University Innovation Capital Fund. He also develops new initiatives to attract outside investment in U-M startups and expand regional and national venture engagement to strengthen Michigan’s startup and investment ecosystem. Mike oversees the Technology Transfer Talent Network (T3N) and the Michigan Translational Research and Commercialization (MTRAC) programs for Life Sciences and Advanced Transportation, which support research commercialization at Michigan’s public universities, as well as U-M’s participation in the Mobility Accelerator Innovation Network under the Global Epicenter of Mobility (GEM) initiative.

Previously, Mike served as Director of Ventures and the first Managing Director of the Accelerate Blue Fund. Before joining U-M, he was Vice President of Business Acceleration at the Michigan Economic Development Corporation, managing a $250 million portfolio of investments in more than 150 early-stage technology companies. Earlier in his career, he was Assistant Vice President at Forest Health Services, where he managed a $50 million corporate venture fund and served as President of Sequoia Captive Insurance.

Mike has led several successful exits (GameZone, Online Technologies, EIP) and founded four companies. He has served on numerous boards, including eBay, PayPal, Compendia Biosciences, and the College for Creative Studies. He is Chair of the Ann Arbor Local Development Finance Authority and serves on the Ann Arbor SPARK Business Development Committee and the U-M Roundtable on Innovation and Entrepreneurship.

Mike holds an MBA (corporate strategy and marketing) and M.S. in natural resource management from the University of Michigan, and a B.S. in history and political science from Eastern Michigan University.

description: Research universities sit behind many of the world’s most transformative technologies—but turning discovery into a scalable company remains one of entrepreneurship’s hardest paths. In this panel, three founders who spun their companies out of the University of Michigan share the real story of navigating IP, early capital, team building, market validation, and the “valley of death.” Moderated by a U-M innovation leader, the conversation explores what support matters most, where universities help or hinder, and lessons for founders, investors, and research institutions alike.

long_description: "Poetic License" follows Liz a former therapist and soon-to-be empty nester, who relocates to a new town for her husband’s job – a place where she doesn’t know a soul. Her quiet attempt to settle in takes an unexpected turn when she becomes the point of tension between two inseparable best friends and college seniors, Sam and Ari. As their fierce competition for her attention threatens to upend their lives, Liz is pulled into a tangle of longing, self-discovery, and the intoxicating thrill of being truly seen – forcing her to confront the life she’s built and the one she still craves.

long_description: Julia was fired three weeks ago. She also got sober three weeks ago. She’s starting over in a suburban rental, and doing a lot of online shopping to help make the space her own, fast. When packages she didn’t order start showing up at her door — a blender, a corkscrew, her signature shade of lipstick — they feel so unnervingly tied to her past that it starts to feel like someone is watching her. The shopping site Smirk denies responsibility. But increasingly paranoid, Julia tumbles down a rabbit hole to find the identity of her anonymous sender.

contributors.details: Aisha Evelyna is an actor and filmmaker focused on centring underrepresented voices. Highlights include her series 'The Drop' (now streaming on Tubi), debut feature 'Seahorse', Vimeo Staff Pick 'Alex', and short films screened at Sitges, Aspen ShortsFest, Austin, RiverRun, Cucalorus, HollyShorts, among others.

long_description: Nola, a sous chef searching for stability, is barely holding her life together. After a brutal Friday night shift, she crashes her bike and wakes to find her estranged father, Cyrus, now unhoused, standing over her. Taking him in forces long-buried wounds to the surface. As past and present collide, Nola is pulled into a reckoning with grief, forgiveness, and the fragile possibility of repair.

name: Stormbound

contributors.name: Miko Lim
contributors.details:
Miko Lim is an award-winning director known for his authentic storytelling in extraordinary environments. 

"Stormbound," Lim’s first IMAX feature film documentary, sees the director partnered with Producer Adam McKay. Filmed on IMAX cameras, the film follows a chronically ill man chasing the world’s largest hurricanes. In 2025, Lim was selected as the only shadow director for Apple TV’s "Murderbot" with showrunners Chris and Paul Weitz, which spent 10 weeks at #1 on Apple’s Most Streamed Chart. His short film "Ocean Mother" won him a Best Director Clio and his Adidas spot “What’s One More” was shortlisted at Cannes. His films have accumulated well over 1 billion views on YouTube, and he has the most-watched Adidas commercial of all time. Lim is a Paramount Global Director Fellow, and a co-chair of the DGA’s first feature film mentorship program alongside Lee Isaac Chung and Celine Song. In addition to his film work, Lim is an avid rock climber, free diver, and surfer, living in LA with his wife and three children.

long_description: Step inside the eye of the storm. "Stormbound" thrusts audiences into the heart of the world’s most powerful hurricanes with breathtaking, never-before-seen footage captured from within. As wind, water, and land collide, the film follows storm chaser Jeff Gammons, who for more than thirty years has pushed closer than anyone else to document every major hurricane to strike the United States. Now tested by a near fatal disease , Gammons continues his pursuit—revealing the personal cost of chasing nature at its most extreme and the larger environmental forces shaping our world. "Stormbound" is a high-stakes, immersive experience that places audiences face-to-face with nature at its most powerful.

events.name: Agridulce (Bittersweet)

long_description: In the summer of 2000, four pre-teen friends formed a band called X-Cetra and burned a homemade album onto a few CD-Rs. The following year, consumed by adolescent concerns of boys and drug store shoplifting, their labor of love was quickly forgotten.... Until 20 years later, when someone uploaded it online. At first, it garnered a small base of outsider-art fans, but soon it was discovered by record labels, sampled by mainstream artists, and eventually the subject of a Rolling Stone article. With their teen dreams of pop stardom coming true decades later, X-Cetra reunites to see if they can rekindle the unselfconscious girlhood they’d captured in the album those many years ago.

events.name: Agridulce (Bittersweet)

long_description: In the summer of 2000, four pre-teen friends formed a band called X-Cetra and burned a homemade album onto a few CD-Rs. The following year, consumed by adolescent concerns of boys and drug store shoplifting, their labor of love was quickly forgotten.... Until 20 years later, when someone uploaded it online. At first, it garnered a small base of outsider-art fans, but soon it was discovered by record labels, sampled by mainstream artists, and eventually the subject of a Rolling Stone article. With their teen dreams of pop stardom coming true decades later, X-Cetra reunites to see if they can rekindle the unselfconscious girlhood they’d captured in the album those many years ago.

contributors.details: Jenna MacMillan is an award-winning filmmaker, producer, and founder of Club Red Productions.  Her feature directorial debut "The Snake" is slated to premiere in 2026. She produced the hit comedy "Who's Yer Father?" (Paramount+), and the internationally sold thriller "A Small Fortune". Jenna was named one of Playback Magazine’s 10 to watch in 2025.

long_description: When Jamie, ungovernable 40 something wild child collides with her venomous mother Anne, her life blows up spectacularly leaving her evicted and single. This sends Jamie on a pig in a hurricane journey for “home”; breaking into her Nana’s house to prove it should be hers, a rejected bid to move in with her van dwelling punk rock ex, and a stint in her best friends pied a terre, which ends with Jamie hooking up with her husband.

name: Fifteen

contributors.name: Jack Zagha
contributors.details: Mexican director, producer, and screenwriter. A graduate of UT Austin, his films Goodbye Cruel World, One for the Road, and Warehoused have screened internationally and received festival recognition. His work blends humor and drama, and has been released theatrically and on platforms such as HBO and Netflix.

contributors.name: Yossy Zagha
contributors.details: Yossy Zagha is a producer, writer, and director. A UT Austin graduate and award-winning advertising creative, he co-founded Avanti Pictures. His short film Yo También Te Quiero won the Coral Prize at the Havana Film Festival. As a producer, his credits include Warehoused, Containment, and Sin señas particulares. His films have earned over 15 Ariel Awards and premiered at festivals including Sundance, San Sebastián, and Morelia.

long_description: Set in Mexico City, Fifteen reimagines the iconic quinceañera as a chaotic mix of comedy and creature horror. Through Mayte and Ligia’s unbreakable bond, the film explores class divides, the illusions of adolescence, and the fear of growing up—wrapped in kitsch aesthetics, blood-soaked humor, and biting social critique.

name: Serling

contributors.name: Jonah Tulis
contributors.details: In addition to "Serling", Jonah is also currently in post-production on "Silk Road", a covert documentary featuring exclusive access to one of the 21st century’s most notorious criminals, the recently pardoned Ross Ulbricht, founder of the infamous dark web site. The film is being produced by DLP Media, Five All in the Fifth & Submarine. Previously, Jonah directed "GameStop: Rise of the Players," which was produced alongside Submarine for NEON. The doc hit theaters nationwide on January 28th, the one-year anniversary of the now famous “GameStop Short Squeeze” that rocked Wall Street. Jonah also directed "Console Wars," the first original documentary from Legendary Pictures and Paramount+, which takes viewers back to 1990 when Sega, a fledgling arcade company, assembled a team of underdogs to take on the greatest video game company in the world, Nintendo. The film was produced alongside Legendary, CBS TV Studios, Point Grey Pictures and Scott Rudin. Jonah was also an Executive Producer on the planned scripted series adaptation of "Console Wars" at Paramount+.

long_description: "Serling" is an immersive first-person journey exploring the life and legacy of one of television’s most visionary storytellers, Rod Serling. Told almost entirely in Serling’s own words, drawn from never-before-heard recordings and personal dictations, the film captures the man behind "The Twilight Zone" in all his complexity. The film weaves archival material with atmospheric recreations that echo the eerie visual language Serling made iconic. As his unmistakable voice guides us, Serling emerges not only as a master of storytelling, but as a man grappling with the trauma of war, the moral compromises of fame, and the hope that America might one day live up to its own ideals.

name: Apolo

contributors.name: Isis Broken
contributors.details: Isis Broken is an actress and singer from Sergipe whose career bridges music, performance, and activism. She gained recognition with the award-winning music video Clã and starred in TV Globo’s soap opera "No Rancho Fundo." Co-director of the feature "Apolo," she released the album Orquestra Sinfônica das Cachorras de Rua in 2025.

contributors.name: Tainá Müller
contributors.details: Tainá Müller is a Brazilian actress, filmmaker, and journalist. She began her career as a reporter for MTV Brasil and appeared in the film "Elite Squad 2: The Enemy Within" (2010). On television, she starred in the soap opera "Em Família" and Netflix’s series "Good Morning, Verônica" (2020–2024). In 2025, she made her feature directorial debut "Apolo."

long_description: "Apolo" follows the journey of a family formed by a transgender couple, revealing the nuances of love, daily life, and the constant struggle for recognition and respect. The documentary offers an intimate look into their family dynamics, inviting us to rethink our notions of affection, care, and society itself. As we accompany Apolo’s pregnancy, we are led to reflect on the challenges and dramas faced by the couple — Isis Broken and Lourenzo Gabriel. The father is the one giving birth, and society is not yet ready for that reality. The feature-length documentary marks the directorial debut of actress Tainá Müller and trans woman and musician Isis Broken.

long_description: Campeón Gabacho tells the story of Liborio, an endearing and mischievous young migrant whose only talent is taking punches. He crosses the Rio Grande to escape a harsh reality in Mexico, looking for a better life in the United States, and settles in a Latino barrio in New York City. Through his fists, his love, and his words, he faces cultural walls and prejudices that threaten his hopes, and becomes a hero in an unknown land.

name: Cornbread Mafia

contributors.name: Evan Mascagni
contributors.details: Evan Mascagni is an award-winning director and producer based in Kentucky. His latest documentary feature, "Building a Bridge," premiered at the Tribeca Festival and was executive produced by Martin Scorsese. Named to DOC NYC’s 40 Under 40 emerging filmmakers, Evan’s recent work has been featured on Sundance TV, AMC+, and PBS. He runs Slaughterhouse 502, a production company proudly based in Louisville, Kentucky.

contributors.name: Drew Morris
contributors.details: Drew Morris is a director focused on subjects who have a peculiar relationship with societal norms. His debut doc feature, "Exile By Choice (2015)," streamed on Hulu. Since then, he has directed documentary projects for Atlantic Records, "Croptober" (2020, a 6 part series), and Joe Budden’s Humans series (2023). Morris runs Born Ready Films, an LA based content house that produces projects for a range of brands and organizations.

events.name: Dead Deer High

long_description:
The unbelievable true story of the Cornbread Mafia, a group of Kentucky farmers who built the largest domestic marijuana syndicate in U.S. history. Sons of tobacco farmers, moonshiners, and bootleggers, they turned to pot to keep their families fed.  

What followed was straight out of Kentucky folklore: lion cubs on the farm, backroad police chases, and a code of silence that baffled prosecutors. Part true crime and part cartoon, the film blends community, the War on Drugs, and a whole lot of weed with the humor and heart of the folks who lived it.

long_description: On January 6, 2023, Republican Governor Ron DeSantis enacted a right-wing takeover of a public university called New College of Florida, targeting both its culture and unique academic program for an ultra-conservative makeover. Resistance is immediate, but the campus descends into chaos as powerful political actors make sweeping changes. Caught up in the mix are a group of intellectually curious young people from all sides of the political spectrum intent on completing their studies at New College, which has suddenly become ground zero in the culture wars.
sort: FIRST THEY CAME FOR MY COLLEGE

films.name: First They Came for My College
films.description: On January 6, 2023, Republican Governor Ron DeSantis enacted a right-wing takeover of a public university called New College of Florida, targeting both its culture and unique academic program for an ultra-conservative makeover. Resistance is immediate, but the campus descends into chaos as powerful political actors make sweeping changes. Caught up in the mix are a group of intellectually curious young people from all sides of the political spectrum intent on completing their studies at New College, which has suddenly become ground zero in the culture wars.
films.logline: When the Governor of Florida transforms a beloved public honors college in a political coup, students and professors confront a new reality: their campus is ground zero in a growing nation-wide assault on academic freedom.

name: Los Lobos Native Sons

contributors.name: Doug Blush
contributors.details:
Doug Blush is an award-winning director, producer, editor, writer and cinematographer whose work includes over 300 feature and television projects. He is a member of the Academy of Motion Pictures Arts and Sciences (AMPAS), the Academy of Television Arts and Sciences (ATAS) and the American Cinema Editors (ACE). Credits include, as Executive Producer, "Like A Rolling Stone: The Life And Times Of Ben Fong Torres" (2021), the Critic’s Choice and Peabody Award-winning (Mr. Soul! (2020), as well as a number of Academy Award-winning documentaries: "The Elephant Whisperers" (2023), "Period.End Of Sentence"(2019), "Icarus" (2018), and, as supervising editor "20 Feet From Stardom" (2013). 

He is also a longtime film educator with classes and seminars at USC, UCLA, Syracuse University and the YoungArts Foundation, as well as exchanges and panels in Indonesia, Poland, Brazil, New Zealand, Armenia, Malaysia, Nigeria, China, Latvia, The Netherlands and more.

Doug co-owns MadPix, a Los Angeles-based production and post- production company.

contributors.name: Piero F. Giunti
contributors.details: Piero F. Giunti is an award-winning Los Angeles–based photographer, filmmaker, and curator whose work sits at the intersection of music, community, and global cultural storytelling. Over the last decade, he has devoted his life’s work to preserving the voices and images of the artists who shaped Los Angeles through A Great Day in East LA®, the largest oral history and portrait project ever created about the musicians of Los Angeles. As a photographer, his lens has captured and collaborated with a wide range of influential international artists, including Public Enemy, Ice Cube, Tom Morello, Zack de la Rocha (Rage Against the Machine), The Black-Eyed Peas, ZZTop, Becky G, Los Tigres del Norte, Los Tucanes de Tijuana and Caifanes. His photographs have been published internationally in outlets including Vogue, Rolling Stone, Billboard, and SPIN.He has served as Los Lobos' official photographer and videographer for the past eight years.

events.name: Agridulce (Bittersweet)

long_description: "Los Lobos Native Sons" is the definitive, authorized chronicle of one of America’s most enduring, genre-defying bands. Tracing Los Lobos’ rise from East L.A. streets to global acclaim, the film offers unprecedented access to their archives and an intimate look at the brotherhood driving their journey. Through electrifying performances and candid interviews—with Linda Ronstadt, Rubén Blades, Tom Waits, Dolores Huerta, Danny Elfman, Jackson Browne, Cheech Marin, Edward James Olmos, Peter Frampton, George Lopez, Bonnie Raitt, and more, the film celebrates their legacy as cultural trailblazers blending rock, roots, and Mexican traditions into a sound uniquely their own.

long_description: After learning his brother’s death may be murder, Ethan returns to Las Vegas to uncover the truth, and confront the violent past he buried. Once a street kid, he’s now living the good life in L.A., engaged to his dream girl and working for her father’s real estate firm. But when he gets a text saying his brother overdosed, the promise he made to never return home shatters, pulling him back into the world he thought he’d escaped.

events.name: Unlocking Her Next Chapter | Fitness with Kayla Barnes
Unlocking Her Next Chapter | Fertility with Dr. Molly Maloof, MD

long_description: Day 3 closes with Dr. Poonam Desai, who will focus on the small, high-impact nutrition and lifestyle shifts that deliver the biggest return on health and longevity. This session will cover what to do—and what to avoid—starting today, including top food priorities, hidden toxin exposures (from water bottles to cleaning products), and simple swaps that reduce toxic load without overwhelm. Dr. Desai will explore longevity through the lens of the lifespan and the decade, from pregnancy and childhood microbiome health to metabolic resilience later in life, helping you identify where your health focus needs a redirect. Grounded in clinical experience, the conversation will cut through wellness noise to offer practical, evidence-based guidance—plus exclusive custom content for attendees to reinforce key takeaways. Dr. Desai is a founder, Longevity Place; double-boarded physician specializing in precision and functional medicine.

related_sales_client.company_bio: Vibrant Wellness is an advanced lab that helps people better understand what’s happening inside their bodies. Our tests explore how genetics, lifestyle, and environment work together across the most critical health domains, including heart and brain health, hormone, gut, immune, and cellular function, food and nutrients, and environmental toxins. We pair standard-of-care clinical markers with innovative and emerging ones to provide a more complete view of health.

name: Same Same But Different

contributors.name: Lauren Noll
contributors.details:
Lauren Noll is an L.A. based actor-director from the mountains of East Tennessee. Her feature
directorial debut, SAME SAME BUT DIFFERENT, is a female-driven ensemble comedy
highlighting three women navigating the tensions of their cross-cultural relationships and the
pressures of modern life, friendship, and womanhood. It will premiere at SXSW 2026.

Hailing from a rich background in theatre, she earned her graduate degree in Acting at Harvard’s
American Repertory Theater (A.R.T.) and the Moscow Art Theatre (MXAT) before her focus
pivoted toward film. Lauren first stepped behind the camera with the short drama HONOR, an
intimate, autobiographically inspired story about coming of age, coming out, and facing
expulsion from Brigham Young University. The film earned multiple awards and launched her
new path as a filmmaker. She followed this short debut with GEN V, which began an ongoing
creative partnership with actor-writer Dalia Rooni and secured the pair a development deal with
Adi Shankar’s Bootleg Universe. The duo went on to make CLEAN SLATE, a recipient of the
Collaborative Film Challenge Grand Jury Prize and a grant from Blackmagic Design, before
embarking to make their first feature film SAME SAME BUT DIFFERENT together.

Most recently, Lauren co-wrote and starred in the Oscar Qualified short film, THE HEART OF
TEXAS, which screened at more than 75 festivals worldwide and earned Lauren a dozen acting
awards on the festival circuit for her performance as Janie May, a down-on-her-luck country
singer caught between a last shot at her dream and the crushing responsibility she bears for
another dreamer she collides with on her path. Across all of her work, Lauren is drawn to
intimate, character-driven stories about ordinary people searching for grace and meaning in
chaotic worlds. Her love for actors and their craft is undeniably infused into her directing style.
She approaches each project with honesty, humor, and deep compassion, crafting stories that
reveal the beauty and hilarity of being human.

events.name: Black Zombie

long_description: When Rana’s visa application is denied, she faces the reality of returning home to Iran. That is, until Adam – her wealthy boss’s son and her summer fling – proposes a green card wedding. Wrestling with the implications of his offer, Rana enlists help from a questionable shaman, Adam’s pure-hearted mom, and most importantly her two Iranian best friends Nadia and Setareh, who arrive on Cape Cod for a wedding weekend full of opinions, chaos, and drama with their own American boyfriends. Just as total disaster approaches, the three women come together in a transformative moment of acceptance, growth, and coming of age – evolving this weekend into one that will change them all forever.

name: Chasing Summer

contributors.name: Josephine Decker
contributors.details:
Josephine Decker is a filmmaker and performer whose work delves into women’s interiority, bending the space between imagination and reality. Her feature film "Madeline’s Madeline" thrusts the audience into the ever-shifting first-person perspective of her main character. "Madeline’s Madeline," scripted through a devised process with ten actors, played Sundance, Berlinale and scores of festivals worldwide, was hailed as a “mind-scrambling masterpiece” (Indiewire) and was nominated for Best Picture at IFP’s Gotham Awards and for two Independent Spirit Awards. Said to be ushering in a “new grammar of narrative” by The New Yorker, Josephine’s other feature films have received many accolades: "Shirley" (starring Elisabeth Moss) won Sundance’s U.S. Dramatic Special Jury Award for Auteur Filmmaking, "The Sky Is Everywhere" (A24/Apple) was a New York Times Critic’s Pick, and her first two features premiered together at Berlinale 2014 and went on to play scores of festival worldwide, winning awards and garnering a retrospective at the Torino Film Festival.
 
She wrote and directed a play with Pig Iron Theatre Company in Philadelphia in 2022, which explored complex decisions around pregnancy through a dream lens. Josephine performed from 2008 - 2015 with the Main Squeeze Orchestra, an all-female accordion orchestra in New York City, and she currently performs as part of a clown ensemble in Los Angeles led by Amrita Dhaliwal.  
 
Since 2022, she has been making a documentary in collaboration with teen mothers in Dallas, Texas. Dallas offers limited access to contraception and health insurance and has the highest repeat teen pregnancy rate in the country. The teen mothers Josephine works with improvise, write and act in short films that create the backbone of the doc.

name: Downbeat

contributors.name: Danny Madden
contributors.details: Danny Madden is known for directing Beast Beast (Sundance + SXSW 2020), David Gilmour's The Girl in the Yellow Dress (2015), and for his animation work on Everything Everywhere All At Once (2022) and Random Acts of Flyness (2018-2022). His second feature as writer/director is called Downbeat, a film about a bucket drummer on the streets of Boston.

long_description:
Down-on-his-luck drummer Mauro flees a trail of bad decisions and lands on his sister Isa’s couch in Boston. With no money and nowhere to go, he begins busking as a bucket drummer. As playing on the streets brings small wins, he falls back in love with the freedom and pounding momentum that made him chase music in the first place. But Mauro pushes his luck pursuing a secret relationship that endangers his bond with Isa, and bit by bit draws everyone else into his own feral shortcomings.
Set to the rhythms of the street, DOWNBEAT is a raw, high-energy portrait of an artist using music as escape and the collateral damage left behind when movement replaces growth.

But Mauro pushes his luck pursuing a secret relationship that endangers his bond with Isa, and bit by bit draws everyone else into his own feral shortcomings.
Set to the rhythms of the street, DOWNBEAT is a raw, high-energy portrait of an artist using music as escape and the collateral damage left behind when movement replaces growth.

name: Jack Johnson: SURFILMUSIC

contributors.name: Emmett Malloy
contributors.details: Half of the directing duo The Malloys, has helmed major sports campaigns for Nike, ESPN, Apple, Google, and the NBA. A Grammy winner for The Big Easy Express and DGA-nominated director, he also made Netflix’s "BIGGIE: I Got a Story to Tell." Malloy co-founded Brushfire Records with Jack Johnson, pioneering eco-conscious music production.

long_description: An intimate look into Jack Johnson’s evolution from surfer to filmmaker to world-renowned musician. The documentary traces how his early years making surf films with close friends became a foundation for a much broader creative life, capturing moments in and out of the water that later surfaced in his songwriting. Blending rare footage from those formative surf films and Johnson's personal and family archives with present-day reflections, the film weaves together how lived experience, friendship, and exploration shaped the sound and stories behind the music.

name: Sonido Cachimbo

contributors.name: Sonido Cachimbo
contributors.artist_connection: Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - Worldwide, PR/Publicity Agency, Producer/Studio Engineer
contributors.details:
Sonido Cachimbo is a cumbia project born in Ciudad Juárez, México, and rooted in the lived experience of the Juárez–El Paso border region. Formed in the early 2010s amid a context marked by violence, migration, and social fragmentation, the project transforms those realities into an energetic and celebratory sound grounded in popular dance traditions.

Blending cumbia with elements of rock, punk, and other hybrid influences, Sonido Cachimbo creates music that invites collective joy while carrying the memory and resilience of border communities. Their live performances are known for their high energy, festive atmosphere, and strong connection with diverse audiences on both sides of the border.

The project has released two full-length albums, Tropicumbia Fronteriza (2014) and Fiesta Popular (2017), the latter co-produced by Rodrigo Rojas of the Chilean band Juanafe, and has collaborated with artists such as Clemente Castillo (Jumbo), Edna Nao, and Paulina del Campo. In 2024, Sonido Cachimbo released “Monitor,” a reinterpretation of the song by Volován. The group is currently working on a new EP of original material planned for vinyl release.

name: Andrea Daniela

contributors.name: Andrea Daniela
contributors.artist_connection: Brand Partnership, Distribution - Worldwide, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
Andrea Daniela was born to be on stage. A dynamic singer, violinist, dancer, and actor raised in Houston, she blends deep mariachi roots with a fearless, modern edge. Her career has taken her to international stages and acclaimed theatrical productions, earning recognition for both her powerful voice and magnetic presence.

Now based in Austin, Andrea steps into a new era with her debut album “Mariachi Mestiza y Mala Mujer” a bold fusion of mariachi, cumbia, pop, and hip-hop that celebrates culture, duality, womanhood, and self-made artistry. As the founder of Houston’s first all-female mariachi band and the creative force behind her own talent agency, she continues to redefine what mariachi means for the next generation.

name: Jacki Daniels

contributors.name: Jacki Daniels
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Distribution - US, Distribution - Worldwide, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, PR/Publicity Agency, Producer/Studio Engineer, Publishing, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details: Jacki Daniels is a Michigan-based, Nashville recording artist known for her powerhouse vocals, magnetic stage presence, and emotionally charged songwriting. In 2025, she was awarded Rising Star of the Year at the Josie Music Awards, the largest independent music awards show in the world, and received four Michigan Music Awards along with the Vehicle City Sound Podcast Fan Favorite Award two years in a row, establishing her as one of pop-country’s most promising new voices. Jacki’s versatility extends well beyond pop-country, with musical roots in rock, folk, a cappella, musical theater, R&B, electronic pop, indie, and classical. She performs everything from intimate solo acoustic sets to full band, high-energy shows, bringing a bold, genre-blending edge to every stage. She is the creator and host of The Jacki Daniels Show and co-host of Singers in the Round, a singer/songwriter showcase highlighting standout talent. Jacki also tours nationally with the Ultimate Kenny Rogers Tribute Show. Check her schedule for upcoming tour dates at www.thejackidanielsshow.com

image.alt_text: CJ CHENIER AND THE RED HOT LOUISIANA BAND

contributors.details: CJ Chenier is born and raised in an indigenous American culture with its distinct language, cuisine and music. Chenier, a Grammy nominated world renowned musician and recording artist, has performed alongside many internationally recognized artists including his GRAMMY awarded winning father, Clifton Chenier “The King of Zydeco,” Paul Simon, Joe Sample, and Ray Parker, Jr. He appeared on the Jon Stewart Show, CNN, was featured on VH1, and Entertainment Weekly.  He has exhibited his musicianship at many large festival venues such as the New Orleans Jazz and Heritage Festival, Chicago Blues Festival, and Austin SxSW Music Conference. In addition, to a GRAMMY award nomination in the Best Regional Roots Music Album category, C.J has received many major awards inclusive of the Living Blues Critics’Poll Award, India Award (from AFIM) for Best Zydeco Album, Coups de Coeur (Blows of Heart) Blues Category Award from I’Academie Charles Cros (France) and Best of the Beat Best Zydeco Album (Offbeat Magazine).

name: Maya Manuela

contributors.name: Maya Manuela
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Publishing, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
Maya Manuela is an indie-pop artist originally from Duxbury, Massachusetts, raised on an oyster farm before relocating to Nashville in 2019 to pursue music full-time. Her work blends intimate, emotionally precise songwriting with warm, modern production—songs that feel confessional without losing their pop instincts.

In 2023, Maya gained viral traction with her breakout single “Multiverse,” sparking two East Coast tours, festival appearances including Levitate Music Festival and Musicians Corner, and support slots for artists such as Angie McMahon. Her momentum continued with her debut album American Doll (2025), a candid and self-aware body of work that explores desire, disillusionment, and identity with quiet confidence. Named Musicbed’s Artist of the Year in 2025, Maya Manuela has emerged as a compelling new voice in indie pop—equal parts tender, incisive, and unafraid to tell the truth.

name: DOSSEY

contributors.name: DOSSEY
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details: DOSSEY started out making squeaky clean pop music in 2017 (NPR’s All Songs Considered actually referred to her in 2018 as “a joyous banquet of roséwave electro-pop”). But by now in 2025, the project has mutated into something brutal, noisy, honest, and unhinged. Motherhood, a slow unspooling of her faith, and the relentless static of American political and social climate have all pushed her toward the genesis of her own brand of dance punk - glitter grunge. So now, DOSSEY’s world hinges on distortion, punk rhythm and anthemic rock vocals influenced by The Clash, Nine Inch Nails and the Yeah Yeah Yeahs.

name: True Jackson

contributors.name: True Jackson
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Distribution - US, Distribution - Worldwide, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Producer/Studio Engineer, Publishing, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
True Jackson is an independent artist who blends 90s grunge rock production with an anthemic pop vocal. A native of Los Angeles, True has been embraced by the vibrant New York music scene, having performed at such legendary venues as the Mercury Lounge, Baby’s All Right, and Le Poisson Rouge, to name a few. 
True channels her emotions into catchy hooks and electrifying guitar riffs, painting a clear picture of where she has been and where she’s going with her debut song: “Paint Me”, released in 2024 and featured in the American High film, 'Prom Dates', streaming on Hulu. 
True’s debut EP, RIP TRUE, was released in 2025 and features standouts “Smooth Talking” and “Bad”.  Making music for the crashout girlies, these 4 songs encapsulate struggling with self-doubt and navigating out of her youth into her 20’s, allowing the audience to scream and dance through life, embracing the imperfections instead of sitting in it.
Her follow-up project explores a toxic relationship and how the heroine ultimately regains her power. The project will be released in Spring 2026 with two lead singles coming just before she takes Austin, TX by storm as part of this year’s South by Southwest Festival.

name: Alex Cano

contributors.name: Alex Cano
contributors.details: Alex Cano is a nationally touring Rock/Americana artist hailing from New York’s Hudson Valley. Known for his rich baritone and soaring, gritty rock vocals, Cano’s sound lives at the crossroads of high octane, blues driven rock ’n’ roll and vulnerable Americana balladry. His debut album, Every Rise of the Sun, is a raw chronicle of resilience and survival—equal parts cathartic release and anthemic triumph. Praised by outlets including Paste Magazine and Indie Current for its authenticity and emotional weight, the record established Cano as a voice unafraid to merge heartfelt intimacy with road-tested rock energy. Cano has toured across the US, performing everything from intimate listening rooms to major festivals. He has shared the stage with artists such as Plain White T's, Gin Blossoms, Tyler Bryant and the Shakedown, Band of Heathens, and Chris Barron. Along the way, he’s built a grassroots fanbase bound by a sense of community, connection, and resilience, values that run through all of his work. With a career already marked by resilience, authenticity, and growth, Alex Cano continues to carve his place as one of the most compelling voices in modern Rock/Americana.

name: Rafa Parra

contributors.name: Rafa Parra
contributors.artist_connection: Brand Partnership, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, Producer/Studio Engineer, Publishing, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
Rafa Parra, cantautor/productor originario de la Ciudad de México. Experimentando con nuevas formas de expresión dentro del pop urbano, mezclando letras románticas con ritmos irresistibles como el dembow y el merenguetón. Su estilo fresco y
emocional invita tanto a bailar como a enamorarse.
Con canciones como “A Besos Si” y “Olaya <3”, Rafa ha comenzado a llamar la atención por su forma única
de contar historias de amor con flow, ritmo y mucha sensibilidad. Su música suena a momentos reales:
mensajes no enviados, fiestas que terminan en confesiones y corazones que laten más fuerte.
Rafa crea canciones que se sienten cercanas, con hooks pegajosos y melodías que se quedan en la
cabeza. Su propuesta es emocional y pensada para conectar con quienes viven el amor con intensidad,
entre el reggaetón lento y las composiciones.

long_description: "Summer of ’94" reveals the wild rise of the U.S. Men’s National Team on the road to the 1994 World Cup—and the history they were never meant to make. With no league and no roadmap, a ragtag group of players and an unlikely coach endured a grueling two-year training camp, hoping simply not to embarrass their nation at the first-ever World Cup on American soil. Armed with camcorders, the players documented it all, capturing raw moments as underdogs grew into future legends. Featuring never-before-seen footage and new interviews with Alexi Lalas, Cobi Jones, Tony Meola, and coach Bora Milutinović, the film shares how chaos, chemistry, and grit forged a brotherhood that changed US soccer forever.

name: CorMae

contributors.name: CorMae
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, PR/Publicity Agency, Publishing, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details: CorMae started as a social media ad and a dream and now has evolved into an up and coming punk and riot grrrl inspired band. The band started in February 2024, and has been steadily making its way into the Austin music scene ever since. Starting with a pop-forward garage rock EP, Cutie Core, released in April of 2025 and ending last year with a bang in October 2025 with the release of their more punk-forward EP “Hot Damn!” and an extra bonus punkified cover of Sheb Woolley’s “Purple People Eater,” CorMae are swiftly becoming an Austin Punk mainstay. The band are nominated by the Austin Chronicle for ATX’s 2025 Best Punk Band and you may also know them from opening shows for the likes of Of Montreal, Murder City Devils, and Pretty Girls Make Graves in 2025. CorMae’s songs are written about life, love, social, and economic struggles and their live show is aimed at commiserating on these issues with the audience. CorMae aims to build a community of friends and fans of all ages, creeds, races, and genders. After all, who doesn’t need a little cathartic shouting or a little dancing every once in a while?

long_description: CorMae started as a social media ad and a dream and now has evolved into an up and coming punk and riot grrrl inspired band. The band started in February 2024, and has been steadily making its way into the Austin music scene ever since. Starting with a pop-forward garage rock EP, Cutie Core, released in April of 2025 and ending last year with a bang in October 2025 with the release of their more punk-forward EP “Hot Damn!” and an extra bonus punkified cover of Sheb Woolley’s “Purple People Eater,” CorMae are swiftly becoming an Austin Punk mainstay. The band are nominated by the Austin Chronicle for ATX’s 2025 Best Punk Band and you may also know them from opening shows for the likes of Of Montreal, Murder City Devils, and Pretty Girls Make Graves in 2025. CorMae’s songs are written about life, love, social, and economic struggles and their live show is aimed at commiserating on these issues with the audience. CorMae aims to build a community of friends and fans of all ages, creeds, races, and genders. After all, who doesn’t need a little cathartic shouting or a little dancing every once in a while?

name: SWDEJAY

contributors.name: SWDEJAY
contributors.artist_connection: Brand Partnership, Other Artists to Tour With
contributors.details:
SWDEJAY (Southwest Ejay) is a first-generation Mexican-American DJ from Southwest Detroit, deeply rooted in the city’s rich musical legacy. Known for his high-energy, open-format style, he seamlessly blends Latin House, Reggaeton, Dembow, Baile Funk, and Ghetto Tech — reflecting both his heritage and Detroit’s forward-thinking sound.

As the curator of Fiesta House, he has played a key role in shaping Detroit’s Global Latin club scene, holding multiple residencies at some of the city’s top nightlife venues while building a cultural bridge between Detroit and the world. His sound has reached international dance floors through performances and productions in Paris, Berlin, London, Chicago, Guadalajara, and Mexico City.

A true ambassador of global music, SWDEJAY continues pushing boundaries — bringing Detroit energy, Latin rhythm, and worldwide club culture together wherever he plays.

contributors.name: Dub Gideon
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Gear Endorsement, Distribution - US, Distribution - Worldwide, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide
contributors.details: The Dub Gideon Band was founded in 2009 on the west side of San Antonio,Texas by a group of young men who were deeply inspired by Bob Marley and the spirit of RastafarI.  After the release of their first EP in 2011, titled "Underworld EP in Dub", and the follow up EP "Live in Love" (2012), the band quickly became a staple at all Reggae events around Central Texas and established itself as a force to be recognized,    Always rooted in the dub tradition the band started to become a backing outfit for artists in the area who they felt needed a platform to perform their music.  The band has backed amazing Texas, international, and Jamaican talent alike such as Likkle Shanx, Jahn TI, Chris Boomer, Island Rose, Moe Monsarrat, Dre Z Melodi, Mister Kali, General Smiley (Michigan and Smiley), Admiral Tibet, Warrior king, Tristan Palma, Spiritual, Luciano, and so many more. Currently based in Austin, the band has re-emerged with a collection of some of Austin's finest Reggae musicians alongside original members from San Antonio.   More than a band, Dub Gideon is a concept, and a force in the world of Reggae Music committed to upholding the true integrity of Roots and Culture Dub Music

name: Louie Lee

contributors.name: Louie Lee
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Distribution - US, Distribution - Worldwide, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, PR/Publicity Agency, Publishing
contributors.details: Change doesn’t ask for permission; it disrupts and transforms. For Louie Lee, this truth began early. Growing up in a trailer park outside Detroit, he witnessed his mother working three jobs to make ends meet, instilling in him an unyielding work ethic. Battling a hearing impairment while soaking in the diverse sounds of metal, hip hop, rock, pop, and country, music became his escape and means of expression. The loss of his grandfather marked a turning point, igniting a new honesty in his songwriting that earned him Song of the Year at the Detroit Music Awards in 2022. Louie Lee's unique sound, labeled Country Hop & Roll, combines modern 808 basslines with country twang, crafting music that feels both grounded and dynamic. His lyrics delve into rarely explored emotional territories, balancing high-energy anthems with heartfelt ballads. Louie’s live performances forge deep connections with audiences, transforming shows into communal experiences where fans actively participate. As a storyteller, Louie is reshaping country music’s landscape, inviting non-country listeners to the genre while redefining its essence. His journey of creation through truth is just beginning.

long_description: After Gloria and Nick break up, Gloria takes us through Nick's dating history, untangling his web of ex-girlfriends through details she can find online. But when she discovers Kaylinn, the hottest most basic ex-girlfriend to ever exist, Gloria not only loses herself, she loses control of the story she's been telling.  Basic is a comedy that blends the magical-realism of jealous paranoia with the magic of falling in love.

name: And Her Body Was Never Found

image.alt_text: And Her Body Was Never Found

contributors.name: Polaris Banks
contributors.details: Polaris Banks loves making movies but has no money or connections. So he foolishly takes on ambitious projects and funds them by selling his body to science and maxing out credit cards. His latest hair-brained scheme "And Her Body Was Never Found" roped in his wife to make a movie with no other crew, just two people in the woods with a camera. Polaris's other bizarrely difficult undertakings include Reklaw, a $200,000 sell-funded short, and Casey Jones, a comic book adaptation featuring a Ninja Turtle.

name: Manhood

contributors.name: Daniel Lombroso
contributors.details: Daniel Lombroso spent eight years building the Oscar-nominated video departments at The New Yorker and The Atlantic before launching Outerboro Films in 2025. His debut feature film, “White Noise,” based on his four years reporting inside the white power movement, premiered in 2020 to critical acclaim. It was named one of the year's top documentaries by Vox and The Boston Globe, and one of the 25 films that explain America by The Guardian. His latest film, “Nina & Irena,” is Executive Produced by Errol Morris and was one of the most decorated short documentaries of 2023. Lombroso’s work has premiered at Sundance, SXSW, TIFF, and has been recognized with eight Vimeo Staff Picks, two National Magazine Award nominations, two Livingston Award nominations, an IDA nomination, a Critics Choice nomination, an Emmy nomination, and the Forbes 30 Under 30 list. “Manhood” is his second feature-length film.

long_description: "Manhood" follows Dallas entrepreneur Bill Moore as he attempts to make penis enlargement as commonplace as Botox. Along the way, an OnlyFans star and a father of five put their bodies—and their insecurities—on the line. Blending dark humor with unexpected empathy, "Manhood" examines shame, addiction, and the fragile myths of American masculinity. From Executive Producers World of Wonder ("RuPaul’s Drag Race"), Sheila Nevins ("Real Sex"), Penny Lane ("Hail Satan"), Producer Kerry Mack ("Proof of Concept"), and Director Daniel Lombroso ("White Noise").

long_description: Macon Blair's third feature is a raucous and wildly entertaining descent into madness. Dave Franco and O’Shea Jackson Jr. are perfectly (mis)matched as Mark and Davis, the fumbling circumstantial chaperones in charge of transporting the increasingly psychotic Sheridan (a brilliant Mason Thames). Phenomenal supporting turns from Nicholas Braun, Peter Dinklage, and Kiernan Shipka round out the ensemble cast, each more unexpected and bizarre than the last. Blair treats us to his signature absurdist sense of humor and douses it with gasoline and psychedelics, crafting an uncanny world where the worst intentions net the highest yields and the open road is full of Shitheads.

contributors.details:
SP
NOA, la nueva cara del Pop Urbano mexa, a sus 21 años, se posiciona como una de las promesas de la escena actual. Es intérprete, compositor y productor musical con formación en instituciones de prestigio internacional como Berklee.
Su sonido es una propuesta distintiva que fusiona la energía del pop estadounidense de 2010 con géneros urbanos y melodías de R&B. Esta versatilidad le ha permitido colaborar con productores ganadores del Grammy y firmar con el sello Cincodoce Music, ademas de presentarse como opening act para artistas como Tito Double P, El Malilla y Bogueto.

EN
NOA, The New Face of Mexican Urban Pop, At 21 years old, NOA is positioning himself as one of the most promising talents in the current scene. He is a singer, songwriter, and music producer with a background in prestigious international institutions such as Berklee College of Music.
His distinctive sound fuses the energy of 2010s U.S. pop with urban genres and R&B melodies. This versatility has allowed him to collaborate with Grammy-winning producers, sign with the label Cincodoce Music, and perform as the opening act for major artists such as Tito Double P, El Malilla, and El Bogueto

contributors.details:
Caleb Michael And The Arrested formed in 2021, but Caleb had been performing and singing for over a decade. Formed a band as quick as he could and became Caleb Michael And The Arrested. 

By 2022, the band was a local favorite in Denton, Celina, and surrounding areas. The crowds continue to grow and the music has become a high energy Country/ Southern Rock vibe. 

Headlining their first Midwest tour in Summer 2025 has raised their expectations and they have set their sights on some pretty big things in 2026!

name: Dead Eyes

image.credit: Dir: Richard E. Williams. DOP: Julian Panetta

contributors.name: Richard E. Williams

image.credit: Richard E. Williams by Anita Alice Photography

contributors.details: With an uncompromising sense of urgency, Richard E. Williams has forged a bold path in independent cinema. From his debut "White Blood" to his ambitious POV sophomore feature "Dead Eyes", he pushes cinematic boundaries while championing a distinctly authentic Australian voice.

long_description: Sean and his fiancée, Grace, enter a remote forest to find Sean’s missing father, Paul, who vanished after the death of his youngest daughter, Lilly. Returning to the site of Lilly’s death forces Sean to confront his inner demons, which begin to materialize externally. Their search takes a terrifying turn, revealing Paul’s secret. He’s been conducting cloning experiments, aimed at resurrecting Lilly. The forest is now inhabited by cannibalistic mutant girls, each a clone of Lilly, battling to prove their identity as the 'real' Lilly. As Sean and Grace uncover the grim truth, they face terrifying creatures and grapple with unsettling questions about life and death.

name: The Peril at Pincer Point

contributors.name: Jake Kuhn
contributors.details: Jake Kuhn is a writer, producer, director, and recent alumnus of the National Film and Television School, where he directed the Python-esque medieval farce Hand to God. A manic screenwriter and lover of all cinema — particularly Austin’s very own Slacker whose commentary track sparked his love of film — Jake directed his first feature with Noah Stratton-Twine: The Peril at Pincer Point, an improvised, Corman-inspired crustaceous comedy set to world premiere at SXSW 2026.

contributors.name: Noah Stratton-Twine
contributors.details: Noah Stratton-Twine is a writer, director, editor, and composer whose work blends sharp character-driven storytelling with a resourceful do-it-yourself ethos — ultimately exacted in his debut feature: an improvised Sasquatch tragi-comedy made for a measly £1000. Amidst chronic cinephilia and a love of walking and wasabi nuts, he continues to develop a percolating slate of scripts and movies across a gallimaufry of genres, including The Peril at Pincer Point — a similarly improvised Corman-inspired crustaceous comedy set to world premiere at SXSW 2026.

long_description: Jim Baitte, a layabout sound designer desperate to prove himself, is working on a new horror flick from the tyrannical yet lauded b-movie director P.W. Griffin. Accused of lacking vision and creative courage, Jim is sent to the remote island where the film was shot to capture a sound powerful enough to elevate the film's finale. Once there, eerie local fables surface: for years, ambitious and headstrong youth have lost their souls to a ghostly sea captain for his spectral crew. As Jim entangles himself further into the bizarre locals, scenery, and prophecy, he can’t help but ponder the ever-confirming legend, and if recording it might just cost him more than his career.

name: fifi knifefight

contributors.name: fifi knifefight
contributors.artist_connection: Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Distribution - US, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - Worldwide, PR/Publicity Agency
contributors.details: fifi knifefight is an Austin based glam punk band known for a powerful live presence and raw sound. Blending punk grit with theatrical flair, this is a must-see act for fans of Hole. Fronted by dynamic lead, the eponymous fifi knifefight, their performances often feature driving rhythms, unapologetic lyrics, and an in-your-face style that's intense yet captivating. Tracks like "joanie" and "THE PARTY" showcase their unique mix of emotional depth and defiance. Often found in downtown Austin and recently featured in several local festivals, fifi knifefight continues to make waves in the indie circuits.

name: SoundMass

contributors.name: SoundMass
contributors.artist_connection: Gear Endorsement
contributors.details:
Sound Mass is an ever-evolving collaboration between Austin’s My Education and Utah’s Theta Naught, celebrated for immersive, cinematic soundscapes and electrifying live performances. Since its inception, the project has captivated audiences with a seamless fusion of post-rock, ambient, classical, and experimental elements, crafting music that is as emotive as it is expansive.

Building on more than a decade of boundary-pushing work, Sound Mass is preparing to unveil a brand-new studio album in 2026, promising bold textures and sweeping arrangements that further refine their signature sound. Their performances at SXSW and beyond showcase the chemistry between these two collectives, offering listeners a transformative, deeply resonant journey through instrumental storytelling.

With a new chapter on the horizon, Sound Mass continues to affirm the power of collaboration and the limitless possibilities of sonic exploration.

name: Grupo Salvaje

contributors.name: Grupo Salvaje
contributors.details: Grupo Salvaje is an Austin-based band with deep Mexican roots and over 25 years of musical experience, delivering high-energy performances that ignite dance floors and bring communities together. Known for their cumbias and crowd-moving rhythms, the group proudly represents Mexican and Latin culture through music that connects generations. Drawing from traditional Mexican styles while pushing a vibrant sound, Grupo Salvaje blends cumbias, norteñas, and nonstop dance music into a dynamic live experience. Their versatility and stage presence allow them to adapt effortlessly to any crowd, making every show a celebration.

name: Grind

contributors.name: Brea Grant
contributors.details: Brea Grant has directed three films -- "Best Friends Forever" (2013, cowriter/costar), "12 Hour Shift" (2020, writer), and the Blumhouse film, "Torn Hearts". She also wrote/starred in the film "Lucky" (2020) , directed by Natasha Kermani. She is also a former actress ("Friday Night Lights", "Dexter"), a book podcaster, and a Texan.

contributors.name: Ed Dougherty, Chelsea Stardust
contributors.details:
Ed Dougherty -- Ed Dougherty cowrote/coproduced the film PAINT IT BLACK with Amber Tamblyn and cowrote the award-winning drama SCRAPPER. He also produced the “D is for Dogfight” segment of THE ABCS OF DEATH. He most recently sold the limited series THE AMITYVILLE HOAX to Peacock. He's a graduate of UC Berkeley and the USC Graduate School of Cinema-Television and was in the 2019 Sundance Film Two Lab. He's also directed music videos for Voxtrot, A Giant Dog, Sweet Spirit, Tracyanne and Danny, and many others.

Chelsea Stardust -- Upon graduating Ohio University's Honors Tutorial College School of Film program Chelsea moved to Los Angeles to pursue her filmmaking dreams. 
Chelsea’s first feature film, the science fiction thriller All That We Destroy, is part of the Blumhouse series Into The Dark and stars Samantha Mathis, Frank Whaley, and Aurora Perrineau. It was written by Sean Keller and James Agnew (Dario Argento’s Giallo, Nicolas Cage’s Rage) and is currently available on Hulu. 
Her second feature film, the horror comedy Satanic Panic, was written by novelist Grady Hendrix (My Best Friend’s Exorcism, How To Sell A Haunted House) and stars Hayley Griffith, Ruby Modine, Rebecca Romijn, and Jerry O’Connell. It was featured in over 20 film festivals all over the world and is currently available on VOD, blu-ray and VHS.

image.credit: Courtesy of Beautiful Stories and AJNA Films

thumbnail.credit: Courtesy of Beautiful Stories and AJNA Films

long_description:
This horror anthology tackles the modern work landscape through four timely perspectives – the hustle culture of an MLM, the endless repetitiveness of a food delivery driver, the online horrors of a content moderator, and the unionization of a familiar-feeling coffee shop. "Grind" shows what it means to be a worker in a world defined by wealth inequality and ruled by endlessly greedy oligarchs, one not so far removed from our own. 

This is a film for anyone who's ever hated their job, had a bad boss, or felt taken advantage of at work. In other words, it's a film for all of us.

name: Never After Dark

contributors.name: Dave Boyle
contributors.details: Dave Boyle is a writer, director and producer working across both English and Japanese-language film and television. His smash hit Netflix series House of Ninjas hit #1 on the platform’s Global Top 10 in 2024. Dave’s critically acclaimed San Francisco set mystery Man from Reno was nominated for the John Cassavetes award at the 2015 Film Independent Spirit Awards and won the Grand Prize at the Los Angeles Film Festival. Past features as a writer/director also include Surrogate Valentine (SXSW, 2011) and Daylight Savings (SXSW, 2012) among others.

long_description: A wandering medium, Airi spends her life guiding restless spirits out of the world of the living. Summoned to an isolated country house, she comes face to face with a grotesque apparition with powers that defy Airi’s experience. As she digs deeper into the house’s past, a secret comes to light — and Airi finds herself hunted by a far more unpredictable force. For the first time, her greatest adversary is not the supernatural, but the living.

name: The Gasoline Gypsies

contributors.name: The Gasoline Gypsies
contributors.artist_connection: Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Distribution - US, Distribution - Worldwide, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
Crisp harmonies, dual lead guitars, and a rhythm section built on drums, bass, and keys makes up The Gasoline Gypsies. But, their recent exponential growth is born of a work ethic that has earned them the reputation one of the tightest bands in Michigan.
Music built to serve the songs, drawing influence from the roots of rock, folk, bluegrass, and country, The Gasoline Gypsies craft a unique style of Americana Rock; Music painting images of the wonder of nature while engaging thoughtful, and mature poetry, spinning themes that invite us to an understanding of our common human journey. A Gasoline Gypsies show asks us to breathe in all of the world, and exhale a unifying message of realistic hope, celebrating both life’s challenges and joys, reminding us that amid the ebb and flow of life, we are all on this ride together.
The Gasoline Gypsies plugged in can rock large venues. Unplugged they can enchant small rooms.
The Eight time Detroit Music Award winners are feverishly followed by their loyal fan tribe, The Vagabundos. Meet a Vagabundo, and you’ll likely be enchanted by an alchemy that draws together the music, the people, and the family that is The Gasoline Gypsies experience.

name: Gus Baldwin & The Sketch

contributors.name: Gus Baldwin & The Sketch
contributors.artist_connection: Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Distribution - Worldwide, Other Artists to Tour With, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, Publishing, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details: Gus Baldwin is a singer/songwriter/ex-hippie/part-time punk from Austin, TX. After a stint holding down drums for Dallas surf punks Sealion in high school, Baldwin went on to form the Psych Pop combo Acid Carousel, which he led for 6 years and 20 something releases before departing the band. Moving to Austin, Baldwin started quickly self releasing a string of singles and EPs on his own GetWithIt! Imprint and establishing himself as the godson of Texas Rock n Roll. Teaming up with former bandmates and friends Gus formed The Sketch in 2022. Embracing the aggression of dirty punk, the looseness of garage, and the charm of power pop, The Sketch established themselves as new cornerstones of the Austin rock scene. Recording their debut LP with the group in one day of recording in LA in the spring of 2024, “The Sketch” is the culmination of Baldwin’s vision, manifested through the power of The Sketch themselves. In late 2025, Baldwin released his first full length solo LP. With the selt-titled debut, Gus focuses in on his rock n' roll stylings, while at the same time showing great versatility as a songwriter. Not being afraid to mix opposite loves of Punk and Pop into one cohesive album.

name: Minori

contributors.name: Minori
contributors.details:
MINORI out of Kingston Jamaica, dubbed 'Mini from the block', has arrived with a freshness. Tough yet full of soul, she bends Hip Hop, Reggae, RNB, Dub and Dancehall into something different, connecting with people at the core level.
MINORI has been touring Nationally through out the USA since 2021 gracing festival stages such as Reggae Rise Up, Cali Roots, Montana Hemp Fest and opening for internationally acclaimed artists such as Nattali Rize and J-Boog taking audiences by storm with mesmerizing performances. Her epic live show is set on the wings of her masterful lyrical content and powerful vocal talent, winning hearts everywhere she steps.
With her 2021 debut single release RED PILL she pushed Hip Hop / Trip Hop realms amassing attention with her fresh original style.
“Play it loud! I definitely give this one the #RebelMusic stamp of approval. Not often you see this style of lyrical delivery
by a sistren, so it’s very refreshing for me. I’ll be anticipating what else is in store”
- Kabaka Pyramid
"There’s an undeniable presence and power in MINORI’s lyrics and vocal flow"
- Nattali Rize

name: ¿Qiensave?

contributors.name: ¿Qiensave?
contributors.artist_connection: Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Booking Agent - US, Booking Agent - UK/Europe, Booking Agent - Worldwide, PR/Publicity Agency, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
Salinas’ own Cumbia Urbana band, ¿Qiensave?, delivers an infectious fusion of traditional cumbia and modern urban sounds, known for electrifying performances that keep crowds moving. With roots in Michoacán, Mexico, and a home base in Salinas, California, the band has been making waves since 2009, blending cumbia with rock, reggae, and hip-hop while bringing their dynamic live show to stages across the U.S., Mexico, and Colombia.
They gained wider attention with their 2019 debut Mujer, featuring “High Class” and “La Fuga,” and continued their momentum with releases like “Mata De Mota” featuring Tropa Magica, “El DUI” produced by Eduardo Arenas (Chicano Batman), and the fan favorite “Quemayama.” In 2024, they partnered with Grammy-nominated producer El Dusty for the remix album Reanimación and collaborated with Chuck Prophet on Wake The Dead, which hit #1 on the AMA/CDX Americana charts.
Now entering their next chapter, ¿Qiensave? prepares to release their new album Así Las Cosas in summer 2026, led by the single “SED De Tu Amor,” as they continue pushing cumbia forward with a fresh, evolving sound.

name: The Last Real Circus

contributors.name: The Last Real Circus
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Booking Agent - US, PR/Publicity Agency, Producer/Studio Engineer, Publishing, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
From Richmond, VA, Jason Farlow & The Last Real Circus craft a raw, soulful blend of Americana and Indie Rock. The project is a musical collective centered on singer-songwriter Jason Farlow, renowned for his energetic stage presence, heartfelt storytelling, and musicianship.
Touring both solo and with his band, Farlow has captivated a loyal following with heartbeat singles like “Nottoway” and “Gypsy Woman.” His sound channels a wide range of influences, from Tom Petty and Joe Cocker to Kings of Leon and Alabama Shakes.
Their rising trajectory has earned them opening slots for an impressive roster of artists, including Jon Russell of The Head and The Heart, Band of Heathens, Blues Traveler, Nicole Atkins, Bones of JR Jones, Devon Gilfillian, Tim Reynolds, Biz Markie, The Sleepwalkers and many others.

name: Lodri

contributors.name: Lodri
contributors.artist_connection: Label Management, Booking Agent - Worldwide, PR/Publicity Agency, Producer/Studio Engineer, Publishing, Sync/Music Supervisors
contributors.details:
Lodri (Rodrigo Nieves) Venezuelan Producer/Composer based in Austin, currently in his beginnings in the music industry.

Actively involved in the city’s emerging music movement. His sound blends Latin rhythms with electronic influences, creating a fresh and vibrant style that represents the new wave of urban music in Austin.

He has taken part in various local and events, collaborating with artists, collectives, and brands that support the independent music culture.

He brings a strong sense of variety and versatility to his instrumentals.

He experiments with genres such as Afrobeat, Reggaeton and Merenguetón, and has also begun exploring styles like R&B, Tech, and Dembow.

contributors.artist_connection: Brand Partnership, Gear Endorsement, Booking Agent - Worldwide, Sync/Music Supervisors

image.alt_text: Chuck Prophet and His Cumbia Shoes

contributors.details:
Chuck Prophet’s streak of more than a dozen critically acclaimed solo records stretches all the way back to 1990, when the California native first shifted focus from his tenure with pioneering neo-psych band Green on Red to working under his own name. Since then, his songs have appeared in a slew of films and television shows, and his work has been covered by Bruce Springsteen, Solomon Burke, Heart, and a host of others. Rolling Stone dubbed him a “streetwise city kid with an eye for the country,” while Uncut proclaimed him a “renaissance-rocker,” and NPR declared that “no one can turn tales from the outer limits into catchy songs quite like Prophet does.” 

Wake The Dead, Chuck Prophet’s extraordinary new album recorded with ¿Qiensave?, dives headfirst into the world of Cumbia music. The songs are intoxicatingly rhythmic, all but demanding you move your body while you listen. There are flashes of rock and roll, punk, surf, and soul, wrapped up in the rich legacy of a genre that traces its roots back hundreds of years and thousands of miles.
